title: Johns Hopkins Menopause Guide
description:
The Johns Hopkins Menopause Guide aims to improve the care of women undergoing menopause. Developed by experts at Johns Hopkins Medicine, the Guide helps healthcare providers of all disciplines practice menopause medicine as well as support the health and wellness of aging women.

The Menopause Guide organizes details of symptoms, treatment, special topics, and management tools into easily accessible, quick-read entries. Content is updated regularly and is designed to help residents and practitioners make decisions at the point of care.

Editor-in-Chief: Wen Shen, MD, MPH
Associate Editors: Christina N. Cordeiro Mitchell, MD., Kamaria Cayton Vaught, MD., Mindy Christianson, MD, MPH

Pharmacology Editors: Jacqueline Y. Maher, MD., Lauren Lakdawala, PharmD., BCACP

Powered by Unbound Medicine, Inc.
